not schlumping.

Good job.

More and more lately.
I have Huntington's disease.

We got married as soon as we realized

I had a fifty-fifty chance,
and I lost that coin toss.
Symptoms started soon after we fell in love,
and Megan knew what it was right away.
Huntington's is brutal. I know how bad this is gonna be.

Josko.

And if I don't,
no visa. I'll be deported.
And once someone is deported,

She left the floor right after you did.
Orderly to the cath lab.
Imbecile!

Code Grey!
Get off me.

Here.

Move the probe up a bit.
Move it up.
What are you doing? Put it back where it was

Incorrect! Pravesh, take over.
Devi, get out of my sight. Move it!

Entering the pericardial sac.
And... we're in.

All right?

Go.

I thought she was a potential star.
Let me know if you need anything, I gotta take this.

Nadine, what a nice surprise.

Can't wait.
And I, have a surprise for you.
What kind of surprise?
It wouldn't be a surprise if I told you.
I'll see you later.
This poor woman.
I wouldn't wish Huntington's on my worst enemy.
Well, hopefully we can give her back
whatever quality time she has left.
I hear Cain is back at Chastain for the first time today.
Yes, for PT. I'm gonna check on him after this. Rongeur.
You know, I know you don't need my advice...
No, I don't.
I think you should cut him loose.
He's more trouble than he's worth.
You're probably right.

We're struggling.
I had hopes for Cain's return. Without him,

You said you were gonna find replacements.
Believe me, I've tried.
Now, complete the word
by placing the correct block on top.

I'm not doing it again. Let's move on.
In order to move on, we need to complete each task.

Don't talk to me like one.
Don't act like one.

Dr. Cain.

You've had some bad luck,

I guess I'm still scared, in a sense.

I mean, every time I close my eyes...
Time will help all of that.
You remember when your mom died?
You and Jessie were devastated, and you both began acting out.
Yeah.
And for several years, you and I drifted apart.
Probably when we needed each other the most.
I was terribly lonely.
There was this guy, a neighbor.
Started giving me attention. You know, having me over

He made me feel special.
Then one day he touched me where he shouldn't.
And he raped me.
How old were you?
Thirteen.
Why didn't you tell me?
I didn't tell anyone.
I was ashamed.
It was difficult and painful.
I'm so sorry, Billie.

Move on.

Okay. Thanks, Caitlin.

You look tired. Please, sit down.
No, I'm not tired at all.

Not in one of my ORs.

I'm very sorry, Barrett, but I can't.

The way you acted this morning is not something I want

That's fair.
I was out of line then.
Just give me another chance.
I'm willing to watch and see

I won't write you off yet,

At this moment,
I see no place for you at Chastain.

Nothing. I will let you know.
He's losing pressure.

All right. There was a tear in the right atrium.

to talk you through every move.
Time is of the essence.
I actually work better in silence.

clamp.
Retractors.

It's right there.
2-0 Prolene.
All right. There we go.
There it is.
That should hold.

There may be hope for you yet.

You may close.

You have Kayser-Fleischer rings.
And that, that is good news?

Yes.
That motion you made with your arm, Megan,

and you do not have Huntington's.

It's serious, but it's treatable.
Wait, so

It looks that way.

but
all of your neurological symptoms
that you've been experiencing
they should all vastly improve.
God, we got married so fast 'cause I had an expiration date.

I was looking forward to that?
We now have a whole lifetime together.
We definitely have to go to Salem.
And Transylvania.

I've always wanted to see a catacomb.

Me, too.

I can't lie.
I wanted so much to be a neurosurgeon.

I wouldn't be so sure.

There's good and bad to your story.
That's not unusual.

My neurosurgery department is dying since we became

You were one of the best.
And I believe in second chances.
I don't know what to say.
I'd like to reinstate your residency on a trial basis.
A month, then we reassess.

Say yes, Billie.
Yes.
Good.
Hey.
Sorry I couldn't make it back.
It's all good. Leela was surprisingly excellent.

To inform me that I'm under investigation.
Investigation for what?
The clinic I ran in my home,
for dating a patient, Micah, and for dating you.

I can't confront him.
I have no proof, but I'm sure it's him.

A-And your chance for a visa.

Listen to me, Mina.
You are not going anywhere.
You hear me?
I know I was hard on you earlier.
It is my job to help you.
You didn't have all the information
that would have made my mistakes make sense.
My entire life I've wanted to be a surgeon,
despite knowing I have one big obstacle to overcome.
You're dyslexic.
You've kept the secret fairly well.
I had a friend in med school who was dyslexic

to make sense of it.
Which is why I did well in the OR.
But when I have to do something new

So I over prepare.
I arrive hours before anyone else,
I review CT reports multiple times, writing down
key information to fully comprehend it.
And you have to work twice as hard as everyone else.

So I didn't get an interview at most residencies.

Look, I'm glad that it is clear between us.

make me understand how I can help you.
Well, I don't want to be treated differently.
I have to be as good as any other resident.
Done.

My policy, too,
until free sushi ruined a long weekend.
Is that the princess?
Princess Nadine.
Yeah, yeah, she, called earlier,
said she was back in town and that she had a surprise.
Pravesh, this is...

Brother, I've got to admit,
you have put me in a vendetta kind of mood.
A rare, special brand of pissed off,

Excuse you.
No.
You don't have to run away from me, Barrett.
I won't hurt you, baby.
Not yet.
See, I had an epiphany,
and the irony is way too sweet.
You're gonna walk away from me, take the elevator
